item.title: LLM as a judge
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: With the robust growth of LLM models currently, there is a new method used to evaluate the performance of large language models (LLMs): LLM-as-a-Judge, also known as LLM-evaluators.

item.title: Evaluation guidelines for LLM applications
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Overview Evaluation is a hard part of building an RAG system, especially for application-integrated LLM solving your business problem. This guide outlines a clear, step-by-step approach to effectively evaluating and optimizing the integration of a third-party Large Language Model (LLM) into your application.

item.title: Evaluating search engine in RAG systems
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Retrieval-Augmented Generation is challenging the world of traditional search engines and LLM information retrieval. Hybrid search, which combines the strengths of vector search and full-text search, offers a powerful solution for the lack of precision in vector search and meaning in full-text search.
